H0.text: If you travel due south from Detroit, Michigan, what is the first country you reach. Mexico

H1.text: If you travel due south from Detroit, Michigan, what is the first country you reach. Belize

H2.text: If you travel due south from Detroit, Michigan, what is the first country you reach. Guatemala

H3.text: If you travel due south from Detroit, Michigan, what is the first country you reach. ᑲᓇᑕ

A5.text: The border follows the Pigeon River, which leads it out into Lake Superior.

A6.text: Detroit is situated on the bank of the Detroit River across from the Canadian city of Windsor, Ontario.

A7.text: Detroit and the adjacent Canadian city of Windsor constitute the second-busiest international crossing in North America, after San Diego–Tijuana.

A8.text: Lake Erie is located on the International Boundary between Canada and the United States, Lake Erie's northern shore is the Canadian province of Ontario.

A9.text: Drivers can cross from the United States to the Canadian town of Fort Erie by going over the Peace Bridge.

A10.text: The United States of America (USA) is a country primarily located in North America.
